sub_title: BSc EE Student at TU Delft & Game Commissioner D.S.B.V. Punch
summary:
During my pursuit of a BSc in Electrical Engineering, I gained valuable experience with a range of technologies and programming languages including Python, Matlab, C, C++, and VHDL. Additionally, I pursued a minor in Computer Science, which has provided me with a solid foundation in the field.

I've been an engaged member of DSBV Punch since 2018, actively participating in various committees and eventually serving as a part of Board 70. This journey has enriched my leadership and teamwork skills while contributing to the vibrant community of the organization and my love for the game of Basketball.

projects.title: Computer Science Project: Game Development
projects.description: Designed and developed an immersive fighting game using Unity, demonstrating proficiency in game design concepts.

contributors.headline: BSc EE Student at TU Delft & Game Commissioner D.S.B.V. Punch

projects.title: Software Engineering Methods
projects.description: Developed a robust task management solution with rich weekly task scheduling, daily routine support, and detailed task specifications. It seamlessly integrates with Google Calendar for easy importing and exporting of tasks.

contributors.headline: BSc EE Student at TU Delft & Game Commissioner D.S.B.V. Punch

projects.title: EPO-4: "KITT" Autonomous Driving Challenge
projects.description: Designed and integrated a localization and control system for an electric toy car. Through implementing algorithms for voice command recognition, autonomous localization, obstacle detection, and communication with a central base station.

contributors.headline: BSc EE Student at TU Delft & Game Commissioner D.S.B.V. Punch

projects.title: EPO-3: Design a Chip
projects.description: Reverse-engineered the MOS 6502 processor. Extensive research was essential due to limited information. We validated four main components using VHDL code and assembled them into a single processor.

contributors.headline: BSc EE Student at TU Delft & Game Commissioner D.S.B.V. Punch

projects.title: EPO-2: Smart Robot Challenge
projects.description: Designed and programmed a wireless-controlled robot to autonomously execute a predefined set of virtual tasks. Leveraged expertise in C programming, and VHDL to enable obstacle detection and navigation within the virtual environment.

contributors.headline: BSc EE Student at TU Delft & Game Commissioner D.S.B.V. Punch

projects.title: EPO-1: Booming Bass
projects.description: Designed and characterized a complete sound system with a 'Booming Bass' extension. Conducted extensive analytical calculations, simulations, and practical testing to ensure the system met specified requirements.

contributors.headline: BSc EE Student at TU Delft & Game Commissioner D.S.B.V. Punch

profile_positions.description:
DSBV Punch Board 70:
-Served as Game Commissioner for DSBV Punch during the 2022-2023 season, overseeing all aspects of game scheduling and match day logistics for the organization.
-Collaborated with the NBB, and opposing teams to address scheduling conflicts and reschedule games as needed, relying on effective communication skills.
-Leveraged Google Sheets as a valuable tool to track the current game schedule, hall availability, and opponent match schedules; enabling quick access to information and facilitating effective decision-making when identifying solutions to complex scheduling conflicts.
-Demonstrated strong time management skills in balancing the demands of game scheduling, rescheduling, and coordination with other organizational responsibilities
profile_positions.title: Game Commissioner

profile_positions.description:
-Overseeing day-to-day IT operations, ensuring the smooth functioning of digital systems, and promptly addressing technical issues to maintain uninterrupted workflows.
-Leveraged Cloudflare's advanced DNS management to optimize domain functionality. Expertly configured essential DNS records, including DKIM and DMARC, for seamless integration with Google Workspace, ensuring secure and efficient email communication. Managed domain ownership and conducted necessary verifications.
-Utilized a Linux VPS with Plesk control panel to effectively manage the IT ecosystem, ensuring reliable performance, security, and cost-effectiveness.
-Seamlessly migrated the dated email system to Google Workspace, enhancing communication and collaboration. Employed spam filters and optimizations for improved security and efficiency.
-Developing a backend system to overhaul data keeping such as member administration. This backend will work in tandem with a new CMS/front end that is also WIP.
-Working on a webshop that caters to the merchandise committee's customers, incorporating Stripe for secure payment processing.
profile_positions.title: Chairman Tech & Media Committee

profile_positions.description:
-Active member of the Activity Committee, organizing 1-2 events monthly to engage members.
-Created budget plans, optimizing resources for successful events.
-Designed eye-catching promotional posters for upcoming activities.
-Part of the Lustrum Committee, organizing a Lustrum Sports Day event and a 3-day Lustrum weekend celebration marking Punch's 70th anniversary.
profile_positions.title: Activity Committee & Lustrum Committee

profile_positions.description:
-Member of the International Tournament Committee, played a role in organizing two successful events (2022 and 2023)
-Developed dedicated event websites to reach out to prospective attendees and provide crucial information in an accessible manner.
                       > https://it.punch-basketball.nl
                       > https://it22.punch-basketball.nl
-Helped with creating the game schedule, and optimizing the tournament experience for participants.
-Designed comprehensive event booklets using Canva, providing attendees with essential information and enhancing their overall event experience.
profile_positions.title: International Tournament Committee
